This forecast is intended to provide information on expected pollution levels in areas of significant public exposure. It may not apply in very specific locations close to unusually strong or short-lived local sources of pollution.
Low air pollution forecast valid from Tuesday 22 January to end of Wednesday 23 January GMT

Tuesday will see rain and sleet soon clearing with icy stretches possible early on,
but otherwise bright with plenty of sunny spells,
joined by scattered wintry showers into the afternoon. <br/><br/>Outlook for Wednesday is bright,
cold and showery,
especially in the east.<br/><br/>The South West breeze will be stronger than experienced on Monday and so aiding dispersal of locally produced pollutants.<br/><br/>Air pollution is expected to remain 'Low' for the following pollutants during the forecast period:<br/><br/>Nitrogen Dioxide<br/>Ozone<br/>Sulphur Dioxide<br/>PM10 particulates<br/>PM2.5 particulates<br/>
Low air pollution forecast valid from Wednesday 23 January to end of Wednesday 23 January GMT
